title: Year of the Elephant (Am al-Fil)
description: Abraha's army attempted to destroy the Kaaba but was defeated by birds sent by Allah. Same year Prophet Muhammad was born.

title: Birth of Prophet Muhammad
description: Prophet Muhammad was born in Mecca to Abdullah ibn Abdul-Muttalib and Amina bint Wahb.

title: Death of Amina (Prophet's Mother)
description: Amina died when Muhammad was 6 years old in Abwa.

title: Death of Abdul-Muttalib
description: Muhammad's grandfather Abdul-Muttalib died. Abu Talib became his guardian.

title: First Revelation at Cave Hira
description: Angel Jibreel (Gabriel) appeared to Prophet Muhammad with the first revelation: 'Read in the name of your Lord.'

title: First Muslims Convert
description: Khadijah, Ali, Abu Bakr, and Zayd were among the first to accept Islam.

title: Open Preaching Begins
description: After three years of secret preaching, Prophet Muhammad began preaching publicly in Mecca.

title: Persecution of Muslims in Mecca
description: Quraysh began persecuting Muslims, leading to the first migration to Abyssinia.

title: First Migration to Abyssinia
description: First group of Muslims migrated to Abyssinia seeking refuge from persecution under the Christian king Negus.

title: Conversion of Hamza and Umar
description: Hamza ibn Abdul-Muttalib and Umar ibn al-Khattab converted to Islam, strengthening the Muslim community.

title: Boycott of Banu Hashim
description: Quraysh imposed a social and economic boycott on Banu Hashim for supporting Muhammad.

title: Year of Sorrows (Am al-Huzn)
description: Khadijah and Abu Talib died in the same year, leaving Prophet Muhammad without key supporters.

title: Journey to Ta'if
description: Prophet Muhammad sought refuge in Ta'if but was rejected and stoned by the people.

title: Isra and Miraj (Night Journey)
description: Prophet Muhammad traveled from Mecca to Jerusalem (Isra) and ascended to heaven (Miraj) in one night.

title: First Pledge of Aqabah
description: Six men from Medina accepted Islam and pledged allegiance to Prophet Muhammad.

title: Second Pledge of Aqabah
description: Seventy-three Medinan Muslims pledged to protect Prophet Muhammad, paving the way for Hijrah.

title: Hijrah (Migration to Medina)
description: The migration of Prophet Muhammad and his followers from Mecca to Medina, marking the beginning of the Islamic calendar.

title: Construction of Masjid an-Nabawi
description: The Prophet's Mosque was built in Medina, becoming the center of Islamic community life.

title: Brotherhood between Ansar and Muhajirun
description: Prophet Muhammad established brotherhood pairs between the Ansar (Medinan hosts) and Muhajirun (Meccan migrants).

title: Constitution of Medina
description: The first written constitution in history established a multi-religious state in Medina with equal rights for all citizens.

title: Change of Qiblah to Mecca
description: Allah commanded Muslims to face the Kaaba in Mecca instead of Jerusalem for prayers.

title: Battle of Badr
description: First major battle in early Islamic history. 313 Muslims defeated 1000 Meccan pagans despite being outnumbered.

title: Expulsion of Banu Qaynuqa
description: Jewish tribe Banu Qaynuqa was expelled from Medina after violating the constitution.

title: Fasting in Ramadan Ordained
description: Fasting during the month of Ramadan was made obligatory for all Muslims.

title: Zakat Made Obligatory
description: Zakat (annual almsgiving) was made obligatory as the third pillar of Islam.

title: Battle of Uhud
description: Battle where Muslims learned valuable lessons. Initial success turned to setback when archers disobeyed orders.

title: Expulsion of Banu Nadir
description: Jewish tribe Banu Nadir was expelled from Medina after plotting to assassinate the Prophet.

title: Birth of Husayn ibn Ali
description: Husayn ibn Ali, grandson of Prophet Muhammad, was born.

title: Battle of the Trench (Khandaq)
description: Strategic battle where Salman al-Farsi suggested digging a trench, a new tactic in Arabian warfare. Confederates withdrew after 27 days.

title: Banu Qurayzah Incident
description: Banu Qurayzah was judged for treason during the Battle of the Trench. Sa'd ibn Mu'az issued the verdict.

title: Treaty of Hudaybiyyah
description: Peace treaty that initially seemed unfavorable but led to greater understanding and eventual conquest of Mecca.

title: First Military Expeditions
description: First military expeditions led by the Prophet, beginning the defense of the Muslim community.

title: Battle of Khaybar
description: Muslims conquered the Jewish oasis of Khaybar after the tribe broke the treaty.

title: Birth of Muawiyah I
description: Muawiyah I, founder of the Umayyad Caliphate, was born.

title: Prophet Marries Maymunah
description: Prophet Muhammad married Maymunah bint al-Harith.

title: Umrah al-Qada (Lesser Pilgrimage)
description: Muslims performed the Umrah as stipulated in the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah.

title: Expedition of Mu'tah
description: First military expedition against the Byzantine Empire. Zayd ibn Harithah, Jafar, and Abdullah ibn Rawahah were martyred.

title: Conquest of Mecca
description: Peaceful conquest of Mecca with minimal bloodshed. Idols in Kaaba were destroyed and the city was purified.

title: Battle of Hunayn
description: Muslims defeated the Hawazin tribe despite early setbacks due to overconfidence.

title: Siege of Ta'if
description: Muslims besieged Ta'if after the Battle of Hunayn. The siege was lifted after the Thaqif tribe accepted Islam.

title: Farewell Hajj (Hajjat al-Wada)
description: Prophet Muhammad's final pilgrimage where he delivered his famous farewell sermon emphasizing equality and justice.

title: Death of Prophet Muhammad
description: The Prophet passed away in Medina at age 63. Abu Bakr was elected as the first Caliph.

title: Abu Bakr becomes First Caliph
description: Abu Bakr was elected as the first Caliph of Islam, uniting the community after the Prophet's death.

title: Wars of Apostasy (Ridda Wars)
description: Abu Bakr fought against tribes that abandoned Islam after the Prophet's death, successfully reunifying Arabia.

title: Death of Musaylimah the Liar
description: Musaylimah, a false prophet, was killed by Wahshi during the Ridda Wars.

title: Compilation of Quran Begins
description: Abu Bakr ordered the compilation of the Quran into a single manuscript after many memorizers died in battle.

title: Invasion of Iraq
description: Muslim forces under Khalid ibn al-Walid invaded Iraq, defeating the Sassanid Empire at the Battle of Chains.

title: Battle of the Bridge
description: Persians defeated Muslims at the Euphrates river, a rare setback in the early conquests.

title: Battle of Buwayb
description: Muslims defeated the Persians at Buwayb, avenging the defeat at the Battle of the Bridge.

title: Umar becomes Second Caliph
description: Umar ibn al-Khattab became the second Caliph. Under his rule, the Islamic empire expanded significantly.

title: Conquest of Damascus
description: Muslims conquered Damascus after a six-month siege. It became the capital of the Islamic Levant.

title: Battle of Yarmouk
description: Decisive Muslim victory over the Byzantine Empire, leading to the conquest of Syria.

title: Battle of al-Qadisiyyah
description: Decisive Muslim victory over the Sassanid Empire, opening the door to the conquest of Persia.

title: Conquest of Jerusalem
description: Jerusalem was peacefully surrendered to Caliph Umar. He guaranteed protection for all inhabitants.

title: Conquest of Caesarea
description: Muslims conquered Caesarea Maritima, a major Byzantine port in Palestine.

title: Conquest of Hulwan
description: Muslims conquered Hulwan in Persia, expanding deeper into Sassanid territory.

title: Conquest of Aleppo
description: Muslims conquered Aleppo, a major city in northern Syria.

title: Conquest of Jundishapur
description: Muslims conquered Jundishapur, an important center of learning and medicine in Persia.

title: Battle of Nihavand
description: Decisive Muslim victory that completed the conquest of the Sassanid Empire.

title: Conquest of Alexandria
description: Muslims conquered Alexandria, the capital of Byzantine Egypt.

title: Umar is Assassinated
description: Caliph Umar was assassinated by a Persian slave during prayer. Uthman was chosen as successor.

title: Uthman becomes Third Caliph
description: Uthman ibn Affan became the third Caliph. During his rule, the Quran was compiled into a standard text.

title: Conquest of Cyprus
description: Muslims launched the first expedition against Cyprus, beginning Muslim presence in the Mediterranean.

title: Conquest of Qazvin
description: Muslims conquered Qazvin in northern Persia.

title: Conquest of Armenia
description: Muslims began the conquest of Armenia, adding it to the Islamic Caliphate.

title: Standard Quran Compilation Completed
description: Under Uthman's direction, the Quran was compiled into a single standard text and copies were sent to major cities.

title: Invasion of North Africa
description: Abdullah ibn Sa'd began the conquest of Byzantine North Africa from Egypt.

title: Conquest of Tabaristan
description: Muslims conquered Tabaristan on the southern coast of the Caspian Sea.

title: Conquest of Khorasan
description: Abdullah ibn Amir conquered Khorasan in eastern Persia, reaching the borders of Central Asia.

title: Battle of the Masts
description: Muslim naval victory over the Byzantines off the coast of Cyprus, establishing Muslim naval power.

title: Conquest of Rhodes
description: Muslims conquered and briefly held the island of Rhodes in the Aegean Sea.

title: Conquest of Sistan
description: Muslims conquered Sistan in eastern Iran, reaching the borders of modern Afghanistan.

title: Conquest of Kabul
description: Muslims first reached and conquered Kabul in what is now Afghanistan.

title: Invasion of Transoxiana
description: Muslims began the conquest of Transoxiana (beyond the Oxus River) in Central Asia.

title: Uthman is Assassinated
description: Caliph Uthman was assassinated by rebels. Ali was chosen as the fourth Caliph, leading to the First Fitna (civil war).

title: Ali becomes Fourth Caliph
description: Ali ibn Abi Talib became the fourth Caliph. His rule was marked by civil wars (First Fitna).

title: Battle of the Camel
description: First major battle of the First Fitna between forces of Ali and Aisha, Talha, and Zubayr.

title: Battle of Siffin
description: Battle between Ali and Muawiyah I. Led to the establishment of the Umayyad Caliphate.

title: Emergence of the Kharijites
description: The Kharijites emerged as a sect after opposing Ali's arbitration with Muawiyah at Siffin.

title: Battle of Nahrawan
description: Ali defeated the Kharijites at Nahrawan, but the sect continued to exist and oppose both Ali and Muawiyah.

title: Ali is Assassinated
description: Caliph Ali was assassinated by a Kharijite during prayer in Kufa. End of the Rashidun Caliphate period.

title: Hasan ibn Ali becomes Caliph
description: Hasan ibn Ali briefly served as Caliph before abdicating to Muawiyah I, ending the First Fitna.

title: Umayyad Caliphate Established
description: Muawiyah I established the Umayyad Caliphate with its capital in Damascus.

title: Battle of Karbala
description: Hussein ibn Ali, grandson of the Prophet, was martyred at Karbala by Umayyad forces. A pivotal event in Shia Islam.

title: Abd al-Malik becomes Caliph
description: Abd al-Malik ibn Marwan became Caliph. He centralized administration and Arabicized the government.

title: Dome of the Rock Completed
description: Construction of the Dome of the Rock in Jerusalem was completed under Abd al-Malik.

title: Al-Aqsa Mosque Built
description: The Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem was built adjacent to the Dome of the Rock.

title: Fall of the Umayyad Caliphate
description: The Abbasid Revolution overthrew the Umayyad Caliphate. Most Umayyad family members were killed.

title: Abbasid Caliphate Established
description: The Abbasid Caliphate was established with Abu al-Abbas as-Saffah as the first Caliph.

title: Baghdad Founded
description: Caliph Al-Mansur founded Baghdad as the new capital of the Abbasid Caliphate.

title: Harun al-Rashid becomes Caliph
description: Harun al-Rashid became Caliph. His rule is considered the peak of the Islamic Golden Age.

title: Bayt al-Hikmah (House of Wisdom) Established
description: Caliph Al-Ma'mun established the House of Wisdom in Baghdad, becoming a center of translation and research.

title: Al-Khwarizmi publishes Algebra
description: Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi published his work on algebra, founding the field.

title: Abbasid Caliphate Begins Decline
description: The Abbasid Caliphate began its decline with increasing regional independence and Turkic military influence.

title: Fatimid Caliphate Established
description: The Fatimid Caliphate was established in North Africa with Shia Ismaili doctrine.

title: Cairo Founded
description: The Fatimids founded Cairo as their capital.

title: Al-Azhar University Founded
description: Al-Azhar Mosque and University was founded in Cairo, becoming one of the oldest universities in the world.

title: Mamluk Sultanate Established
description: The Mamluk Sultanate was established in Egypt after overthrowing the Ayyubid dynasty.

title: Mongol Siege of Baghdad
description: Mongols under Hulagu Khan sacked Baghdad, ending the Abbasid Caliphate. Massive loss of knowledge and culture.

title: Ottoman State Founded
description: Osman I founded the Ottoman Beylik, which would become the Ottoman Empire.

title: Fall of Constantinople
description: Mehmed II conquered Constantinople, renaming it Istanbul. End of the Byzantine Empire.

title: Mughal Empire Founded
description: Babur founded the Mughal Empire in India after the First Battle of Panipat.

title: Ottoman Empire at Peak under Suleiman
description: Suleiman the Magnificent became Sultan. The Ottoman Empire reached its zenith.

title: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab Born
description: Birth of Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab, founder of the Wahhabi movement.

title: Wahhabi-Saudi Alliance
description: Muhammad ibn Saud and Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab formed an alliance, founding the First Saudi State.

title: Ottoman Caliphate Abolished
description: The Turkish Grand National Assembly abolished the Ottoman Caliphate. End of 1300 years of Islamic caliphate.

title: Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Founded
description: Abdulaziz Ibn Saud unified the kingdoms of Hejaz and Nejd, founding the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

title: Pakistan Created
description: Pakistan was created as the first independent Muslim state in South Asia.

title: State of Israel Established
description: The State of Israel was established, leading to the Palestinian Nakba (catastrophe).

title: Al-Qaeda Formed
description: Al-Qaeda was formed by Osama bin Laden and others.

title: Arab Spring Begins
description: The Arab Spring uprisings began in Tunisia, spreading across the Arab world.

title: ISIS Caliphate Declared
description: ISIS declared a caliphate in parts of Iraq and Syria.

title: Grand Mosque Expansion Completed
description: Major expansion of the Grand Mosque in Mecca was completed, accommodating millions more pilgrims.
